required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Certain Breakfasts on Appetite Control
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled, Cross-over Study of the Effect of Certain Breakfasts on Appetite Control.

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Boniface General Hospital Research Centre

clinical_study.source: St. Boniface General Hospital Research Centre

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial is being conducted to study whether eating certain meals will reduce your desire to eat and for a longer period of time compared to others and to determine the post-meal glucose response associated with each of these breakfast foods.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is divided into 3 phases. Each phase involves eating one of 3 different breakfasts every day for 1 month. The order of the breakfast products is random. During each phase participants will come to the research clinic for 4 visits (1 per week) for assessment of appetite-related sensations. Gastric emptying will be assessed at 1 visit per phase and post prandial glucose response will be measured at 1 visit per phase (Asper site only).

primary_outcome.time_frame: before the breakfast and every 30 minutes after breakfast for 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: Total area under the curve (AUC) for hunger, fullness, desire to eat, and prospective consumption scales

primary_outcome.time_frame: before the breakfast and every 15 minutes after breakfast for 4 hours
primary_outcome.description: 13C-Octanoic Acid will be incorporated into the breakfast food. Rate of gastric emptying will be determined by measuring 13C in breath samples.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before the breakfast and at 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after the the breakfast.
secondary_outcome.description: Total area under the curve (iAUC, mmol*min/L) for both glucose and insulin
Measure the amount of kilocalories consumed throughout each test day.

other_outcome.description: Incidence and duration of gastrointestinal side effects.

arm_group.description: breakfast food containing high viscosity fibre
breakfast food containing low viscosity fibre

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy Males and females (not pregnant or lactating) aged 19 to 60 years.
2. Body mass index: 18.5-30 kg/m2.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. A change in medication (dose or type) or medical event requiring hospitalization within the past month.
2. Daily tobacco use.
3. Physical Activity Level >1.8.
4. Eat meals at irregular or unusual times.
5. Food allergy, aversion or unwillingness to eat study foods.
6. Use of any prescription or non-prescription drug, herbal or nutritional supplement known to affect appetite or blood sugar.
7. Presence of a gastrointestinal disorder.
8. Taking drugs that affect gastric emptying.
9. Score >65% on any 1 of the 3 categories of the Three Factor Eating Questionnaire-R18.

overall_official.affiliation: I.H. Asper Clinical Research Institute/Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
Richardson Centre for Functional Foods and Nutraceuticals/Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada

facility.name: Richardson Centre for Functional Foods and Nutraceuticals
